snippet: The president, addressing critics in both parties, asserted that the United States has a “strategic interest in pushing back” ISIS.
abstract: Pres Obama says he is open to supporting sustained effort to drive Sunni militants out of Iraq if Iraqi leaders form more inclusive government; acknowledges that United States has 'strategic interest' in pushing back Islamic State in Iraq and Syria fighters, but insists that America is not going to take over role of Iraq's air force.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

lead_paragraph: The president, addressing critics in both parties, asserted that the United States has a “strategic interest in pushing back” ISIS.

headline.main: While Offering Support, Obama Warns That U.S. Won’t Be ‘Iraqi Air Force’
headline.print_headline: While Offering Support, Obama Warns That U.S. Won’t Be ‘Iraqi Air Force’

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
